CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: According to the equation E LUMO = E HOMO + E g,opt , the LUMO energy level of PSFDTBT was calculated to be -3.43 eV. The LUMO energy level of PSFDTBT is positioned about 0.80 eV above that of PC71BM ( 4.2 eV , measured under the same condition ) , which offers enough driving force for charge separation and transfer without too much energy loss. 5,17 Transport Properties. The transport properties of the polymer were investigated by fabricating organic thin film fieldeffect transistors ( OFETs ). Typical p-channel field - effect transistor behavior was obtained. The hole mobility ( μ ) was estimated in the saturated regime from the derivative plots of the square root of source - drain current ( I SD ) versus gate voltage ( V G ) through equation 2 where W is the channel width , L is the channel length , C i is the capacitance per unit area of the gate dielectric layer ( SiO 2 , 500 nm , C i = 7.5 nF / cm^2 ) , and V T is the threshold voltage. The output ( a ) and transfer characteristics ( b ) of the spin - coated PSFDTBT films are shown in Figure 2. The hole mobility of the pristine PSFDTBT film spin - cast from DCB solution is 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 with on / off ratios in the order of 10^5 , which is almost two orders higher than that of P1 ( the hole mobility of pure P1 film is 2 × 10^-5 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 ). 8 Such comparable high mobility is beneficial for charge transfer in the resulting PSCs. 5 For the PSFDTBT / PC71BM blend film ( in a weight ratio of 1 : 3 , spin - coated from ODCB solutions ) , hole mobility ( μ hole ) of 1.14 × 10^-2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 and electron mobility ( μ e ) of 2.7 × 10^-4 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 were obtained. I SD = ( W / 2L)C i μ(V G - V T ) Photovoltaic Properties. Broad absorption , appropriate HOMO / LUMO positions , and comparable hole mobility make PSFDTBT a promising donor material in BHJ PSCs. Therefore , the photovoltaic performance of PSFDTBT was investigated in PSCs. Polymer solar cells with a device configuration of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / LiF / Al were fabricated and characterized under the illumination of AM1.5G ( 100 mW / cm^2 ). The weight ratio of PSFDTBT to PC71BM and the processing solvent have been carefully optimized. The results are summarized in Table 1. Using DCB as the processing solvent , four polymer solar cells with blends of PSFDTBT and PC71BM in weight ratios of 1 : 2.5 , 1 : 3 , 1 : 3.5 , and 1 : 4 , respectively , as the active layer were fabricated , and their J-V curves are shown in Figure 3a. In all cases , PCEs of about 4.1% were obtained.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PSFDTBT |
| PC71BM |
| P1 |
| DCB |
| ODCB |
| ITO |
| PEDOT : PSS |
| LiF |
| Al |

Note:

* PSFDTBT and PC71BM are the two main materials discussed in the paragraph.
* P1 is mentioned as a reference material for comparison of hole mobility.
* DCB and ODCB are solvents used for spin-coating the films.
* ITO, PEDOT : PSS, LiF, and Al are materials used in the fabrication of organic thin-film field-effect transistors (OFETs) and polymer solar cells (PSCs).

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PSFDTBT |
| PC71BM |
| P1 |

Note:

* DCB and ODCB are solvents, not materials.
* ITO, PEDOT : PSS, LiF, and Al are materials, but they are not referred to as "material names" in the paragraph.
* The phrase "material name" is not explicitly mentioned in the paragraph, but the names of the materials are clearly identified and referred to as such.

Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: According to the equation E LUMO = E HOMO + E g,opt , the LUMO energy level of PSFDTBT was calculated to be -3.43 eV. The LUMO energy level of PSFDTBT is positioned about 0.80 eV above that of PC71BM ( 4.2 eV , measured under the same condition ) , which offers enough driving force for charge separation and transfer without too much energy loss. 5,17 Transport Properties. The transport properties of the polymer were investigated by fabricating organic thin film fieldeffect transistors ( OFETs ). Typical p-channel field - effect transistor behavior was obtained. The hole mobility ( μ ) was estimated in the saturated regime from the derivative plots of the square root of source - drain current ( I SD ) versus gate voltage ( V G ) through equation 2 where W is the channel width , L is the channel length , C i is the capacitance per unit area of the gate dielectric layer ( SiO 2 , 500 nm , C i = 7.5 nF / cm^2 ) , and V T is the threshold voltage. The output ( a ) and transfer characteristics ( b ) of the spin - coated PSFDTBT films are shown in Figure 2. The hole mobility of the pristine PSFDTBT film spin - cast from DCB solution is 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 with on / off ratios in the order of 10^5 , which is almost two orders higher than that of P1 ( the hole mobility of pure P1 film is 2 × 10^-5 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 ). 8 Such comparable high mobility is beneficial for charge transfer in the resulting PSCs. 5 For the PSFDTBT / PC71BM blend film ( in a weight ratio of 1 : 3 , spin - coated from ODCB solutions ) , hole mobility ( μ hole ) of 1.14 × 10^-2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 and electron mobility ( μ e ) of 2.7 × 10^-4 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 were obtained. I SD = ( W / 2L)C i μ(V G - V T ) Photovoltaic Properties. Broad absorption , appropriate HOMO / LUMO positions , and comparable hole mobility make PSFDTBT a promising donor material in BHJ PSCs. Therefore , the photovoltaic performance of PSFDTBT was investigated in PSCs. Polymer solar cells with a device configuration of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / LiF / Al were fabricated and characterized under the illumination of AM1.5G ( 100 mW / cm^2 ). The weight ratio of PSFDTBT to PC71BM and the processing solvent have been carefully optimized. The results are summarized in Table 1. Using DCB as the processing solvent , four polymer solar cells with blends of PSFDTBT and PC71BM in weight ratios of 1 : 2.5 , 1 : 3 , 1 : 3.5 , and 1 : 4 , respectively , as the active layer were fabricated , and their J-V curves are shown in Figure 3a. In all cases , PCEs of about 4.1% were obtained.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name | Description |
| --- | --- |
| E LUMO | LUMO energy level of PSFDTBT |
| E HOMO | HOMO energy level of PSFDTBT |
| E g,opt | Optical gap of PSFDTBT |
| μ | Hole mobility of PSFDTBT |
| μ hole | Hole mobility of PSFDTBT/PC71BM blend |
| μ e | Electron mobility of PSFDTBT/PC71BM blend |
| I SD | Source-drain current |
| V G | Gate voltage |
| W | Channel width |
| L | Channel length |
| C i | Capacitance per unit area of gate dielectric layer |
| V T | Threshold voltage |
| PCE | Power conversion efficiency |
| J-V curve | J-V characteristic curve of a solar cell |

Note: The property names are presented in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Property name of material" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| E LUMO |
| E HOMO |
| E g,opt |
| μ |
| μ hole |
| μ e |

The following entities do not clearly refer to "Property name of material" and were removed:

* I SD (source-drain current)
* V G (gate voltage)
* W (channel width)
* L (channel length)
* C i (capacitance per unit area of gate dielectric layer)
* V T (threshold voltage)
* PCE (power conversion efficiency)
* J-V curve (J-V characteristic curve of a solar cell)

Paragraph: According to the equation E LUMO = E HOMO + E g,opt , the LUMO energy level of PSFDTBT was calculated to be -3.43 eV. The LUMO energy level of PSFDTBT is positioned about 0.80 eV above that of PC71BM ( 4.2 eV , measured under the same condition ) , which offers enough driving force for charge separation and transfer without too much energy loss. 5,17 Transport Properties. The transport properties of the polymer were investigated by fabricating organic thin film fieldeffect transistors ( OFETs ). Typical p-channel field - effect transistor behavior was obtained. The output ( a ) and transfer characteristics ( b ) of the spin - coated PSFDTBT films are shown in Figure 2. I SD = ( W / 2L)C i μ(V G - V T ) Photovoltaic Properties. Broad absorption , appropriate HOMO / LUMO positions , and comparable hole mobility make PSFDTBT a promising donor material in BHJ PSCs. Therefore , the photovoltaic performance of PSFDTBT was investigated in PSCs. Polymer solar cells with a device configuration of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC71BM / LiF / Al were fabricated and characterized under the illumination of AM1.5G ( 100 mW / cm^2 ). The weight ratio of PSFDTBT to PC71BM and the processing solvent have been carefully optimized. The results are summarized in Table 1. Using DCB as the processing solvent , four polymer solar cells with blends of PSFDTBT and PC71BM in weight ratios of 1 : 2.5 , 1 : 3 , 1 : 3.5 , and 1 : 4 , respectively , as the active layer were fabricated , and their J-V curves are shown in Figure 3a. In all cases , PCEs of about 4.1% were obtained.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value | Description |
| --- | --- |
| -3.43 eV | LUMO energy level of PSFDTBT |
| 4.2 eV | HOMO energy level of PC71BM |
| 0.80 eV | Energy difference between LUMO of PSFDTBT and HOMO of PC71BM |
| 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 | Hole mobility of pristine PSFDTBT film |
| 2 × 10^-5 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 | Hole mobility of pure P1 film |
| 1.14 × 10^-2 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 | Hole mobility of PSFDTBT / PC71BM blend film |
| 2.7 × 10^-4 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 | Electron mobility of PSFDTBT / PC71BM blend film |
| 10^5 | On/off ratio of pristine PSFDTBT film |
| 100 mW/cm^2 | Illumination intensity under AM1.5G |
| 1:2.5, 1:3, 1:3.5, 1:4 | Weight ratios of PSFDTBT to PC71BM in PSCs |
| 4.1% | PCEs of PSCs with different weight ratios |

Note:

* LUMO and HOMO represent the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital and the highest occupied molecular orbital, respectively.
* PCEs stands for power conversion efficiencies.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value | Description |
| --- | --- |
| -3.43 eV | LUMO energy level of PSFDTBT |
| 4.2 eV | HOMO energy level of PC71BM |
| 0.80 eV | Energy difference between LUMO of PSFDTBT and HOMO of PC71BM |
| 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 | Hole mobility of pristine PSFDTBT film |
| 2 × 10^-5 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 | Hole mobility of pure P1 film |
| 1.14 × 10^-2 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 | Hole mobility of PSFDTBT / PC71BM blend film |

The following entities do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and were removed:

* "10^5" (on/off ratio of pristine PSFDTBT film)
* "100 mW/cm^2" (illumination intensity under AM1.5G)
* "1:2.5, 1:3, 1:3.5, 1:4" (weight ratios of PSFDTBT to PC71BM in PSCs)
* "4.1%" (PCEs of PSCs with different weight ratios)
